qas.question: About how many Australians were taken prisoner after the fall of Singapore and British Malaya?
In what year did Japan establish a base in New Guinea?
What date was the Australian mainland first attacked?
What mainland Australian city was attacked by the Japanese on February 19?
For how many months was Australia attacked from the air by Japan?

context: Australia had been shocked by the speedy collapse of British Malaya and Fall of Singapore in which around <a0_0>15,000<a0_0/> Australian soldiers became prisoners of war. Curtin predicted that the "battle for Australia" would now follow. The Japanese established a major base in the Australian Territory of New Guinea in early <a1_0>1942<a1_0/>. On <a2_0>19 February<a2_0/>, <a3_0>Darwin<a3_0/> suffered a devastating air raid, the first time the Australian mainland had been attacked. Over the following <a4_0>19<a4_0/> months, Australia was attacked from the air almost 100 times.
